item.title: Qué significa officious
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en ocho artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Word of the Day: officious
item.description: This word has appeared in eight articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Colbert Doesn’t Give an FCC About Calling Out CBS
item.description: “And because my network clearly doesn’t want us to talk about this, let’s talk about this,” Stephen Colbert said after CBS canceled a Texas congressman’s appearance on Monday’s “Late Show.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Last Week Tonight With John Oliver (TV Program)
Real Time With Bill Maher (TV Program)

item.title: U.S. and Iran’s High-Stakes Nuclear Talks Set to Kick Off
item.description: The U.S. and Iran have been flexing their military might as negotiators from the two countries resume nuclear talks in Switzerland.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Paik

media:content.media:description: Steve Witkoff, the Middle East envoy, and Jared Kushner, President Trump’s son-in-law, in Davos, Switzerland, last month. They are expected to attend the negotiations with Iran in Geneva on Tuesday.

item.title: Brasil coquetea con el poliamor
item.description: En un país aún mayoritariamente conservador y religioso, crece un movimiento en el que cada vez más gente adopta distintas formas de amor, matrimonio y paternidad.
item.dc:creator: Ana Ionova and María Magdalena Arréllaga

media:content.media:credit: Maria Magdalena Arrellaga for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Friends and members of the same polycule, from left, Victor Souza, Jessica Couri, Rafael Pissurno and Iuli Duerte, meeting for breakfast in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: Memorials for Iran’s Slain Protesters Wil Test of State Crackdown
item.description: Ceremonies commemorating the 40 days after protesters were killed are planned this week, challenging the authorities’ ability to restrain them.
item.dc:creator: Erika Solomon and Leily Nikounazar

media:content.media:description: Downtown Tehran this month. This week, families across Iran will commemorate the 40th-day memorials of thousands of Iranians killed Jan. 8-10.

item.title: A Rio Carnival Party That Goes On and On
item.description: The Boi Tolo, one of the city’s most iconic street parties, has come to represent the glittery, gritty grass-roots celebration far from the glamour of the official parades.
item.dc:creator: Ana Ionova and Dado Galdieri

media:content.media:description: Revelers taking part in the Boi Tolo on Sunday in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia Hold New Round of Peace Talks, but Expectations Are Low
item.description: Both sides described previous U.S.-mediated negotiations as productive, although they did not appear to address sticking points like territory and security guarantees.
item.dc:creator: Constant Méheut

media:content.media:description: A Ukrainian artillery brigade firing at Russian targets in the Zaporizhzhia region of eastern Ukraine in October.

item.title: U.S. and Iran Gear Up for Nuclear Talks Amid Rising Tensions
item.description: President Trump has called on Iran to reach an immediate accord or else face the threat of a possible U.S. attack.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Boxerman

media:content.media:description: Steve Witkoff, the Middle East envoy, and Jared Kushner, President Trump’s son-in-law, in Davos, Switzerland, last month. They are expected to attend the negotiations with Iran in Geneva on Tuesday.

item.title: Height Surgery for Men Can Add Inches But Has Risks
item.description: Limb-lengthening can add inches to a person’s stature. But its risks have made it controversial.
item.dc:creator: Isabella Kwai and Matthew Leifheit

media:content.media:description: After his surgery, Mr. Trinh kept a meticulous log of his recovery that he shared on a Discord server dedicated to limb-lengthening.

item.title: Questions Swirl Around Russian Figure Skater in Her Olympic Debut
item.description: Adeliia Petrosian, 18, has the résumé of a medal contender — and ties to coaches and a skater who were at the center of a doping scandal at the last Winter Games.
item.dc:creator: Juliet Macur

media:content.media:description: Adeliia Petrosian has skated outside Russia only once since 2022. She makes her Olympic debut on Tuesday at the Winter Games in Milan.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Kennedy Allies Target States to Repeal Child-Immunization Mandates
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, February 17, 2026.

item.title: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass
item.description: The chairman, Casey Wasserman, has faced criticism ever since his name surfaced in the Epstein files. Mayor Karen Bass is the latest official to call on him to step down.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Hubler
item.category: Los Angeles Organizing Committee for the Olympic and Paralympic Games 2028 (LA28)

media:content.media:description: Casey Wasserman, a powerful Los Angeles entertainment executive, has faced increasing calls from leaders in the city to resign as chairman of the 2028 Olympics organizing committee.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Feb. 17, 2026
item.description: Stephan Prock and Jeff Chen collaborate on their second puzzle.
item.dc:creator: Hrishikesh Hirway

media:content.media:credit: Junior D. Kannah/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: This one is for the music lovers.

item.title: No Corrections: Feb. 17, 2026
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Tuesday, Feb. 17, 2026.

item.title: Frederick Wiseman Watched People Like Nobody Else
item.description: For more than 50 years, the influential documentarian found inspiration in filming the ways his ordinary subjects lived their lives.
item.dc:creator: Alissa Wilkinson

media:content.media:description: Frederick Wiseman’s direct cinema style and sharp observations made him a near-peerless documentary filmmaker.

item.title: ‘Shoresy’ Is Back, a Hockey Sitcom With ‘Heated Rivalry’ Ties
item.description: If you want more Canadian TV series about emotionally complex hockey players, look no further.
item.dc:creator: Noel Murray

media:content.media:description: Jared Keeso in a scene from Season 5 of “Shoresy.”

item.title: At Least 2 Killed During High School Hockey Game in Rhode Island
item.description: The shooting occurred at Dennis M. Lynch Arena in Pawtucket, R.I., on Monday. The shooter is dead, the authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Meg Felling

media:content.media:description: State Police outside the Dennis M. Lynch Arena, an indoor ice skating rink, after a shooting in Pawtucket, R.I., on Monday.

item.title: After Trip to Germany, AOC Expresses Frustrations
item.description: The congresswoman argued in an interview that presidential speculation, which included scrutiny of her slip-ups, had overshadowed her anti-authoritarian message at the Munich Security Conference.
item.dc:creator: Kellen Browning

media:content.media:credit: Gordon Welters for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez used her trip to Germany to argue that the best way to counteract far-right movements was to address people’s economic struggles.

item.title: Anderson Cooper Is Leaving ’60 Minutes’
item.description: Mr. Cooper said in a statement that he was leaving as a correspondent for the show to focus on his CNN program and spend more time with his children.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Mullin

media:content.media:credit: Adrienne Grunwald for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Anderson Cooper has been a correspondent on the CBS newsmagazine for almost 20 years.

item.title: ‘The Last Straw’: T.S.A. Agents Brace for Another D.H.S. Shutdown
item.description: After funding for the Department of Homeland Security lapsed on Saturday, Transportation Security Administration employees expressed frustration at being forced to work without pay. Many have barely recovered from last year’s 43-day shutdown and now face the prospect of another period of financial uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Cynthia Silva

media:content.media:credit: Nicole Craine for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The shutdown is especially hard for T.S.A. employees this time around, because many are just recovering from the financial strain they suffered during last year’s 43-day shutdown.

item.title: Oscar-Winning Actor Robert Duvall Dies at 95
item.description: Robert Duvall, an Academy Award-winning actor known for playing a wide range of characters in films such as “Apocalypse Now” and “The Godfather,” died on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Jackeline Luna

media:content.media:description: Mr. Duvall backstage after winning the Academy Award for best actor in April 1984.

item.title: La autopromoción de Trump aviva el culto a la personalidad en EE. UU.
item.description: El presidente ha emprendido una campaña de autoglorificación inédita, creando un personaje mitificado y sobrehumano y convirtiéndose en una fuerza ineludible tanto en su país como en el resto del mundo.
item.dc:creator: Peter Baker

media:content.media:credit: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: “Don Colossus”, una estatua de bronce de 4,5 metros del presidente Trump, en el estudio del escultor en Zanesville, Ohio, a principios de este mes.

item.title: Teacher Killed in Crash After Man Fled in Car From ICE, Police Say
item.description: The man, who federal officials said had entered the United States illegally, was arrested and charged with first-degree homicide after the crash in Savannah, Ga., according to the county police.
item.dc:creator: Soumya Karlamangla

item.title: Robert Duvall: A Life in Pictures
item.description: The actor, who had a knack for embodying a wealth of varied characters, had a sprawling and celebrated career.
item.dc:creator: Michaela Towfighi

item.title: Investigators Hope DNA Testing Can Provide Breakthrough in Guthrie Case
item.description: An expert said lab analysis of gloves found near Nancy Guthrie’s home could produce results within days.
item.dc:creator: Audra D. S. Burch

media:content.media:credit: Cassidy Araiza for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The F.B.I. said the glove appeared similar to those worn by the masked man whose image was captured in surveillance footage from Nancy Guthrie’s doorbell camera.

item.title: Japan Wins Pairs Figure Skating, Knocking China From the Top
item.description: Riku Miura and Ryuichi Kihara of Japan emerged with the gold medal with a flawless, high-scoring performance after Monday’s free skate.
item.dc:creator: Victor Mather, Doug Mills and Vincent Alban

item.title: Judge Orders Trump Administration to Restore Displays About Slavery at Washington’s House
item.description: The judge said the government did not have the power to erase or alter historical truths after the administration took down displays about slavery at the President’s House Site in Philadelphia.
item.dc:creator: Anushka Patil

media:content.media:credit: Hannah Yoon for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: City officials sued the Interior Department after National Park Service workers took down the exhibits at the President’s House Site in Philadelphia last month.

item.title: ¿La IA reemplazará a los traductores?
item.description: Los libros de una editorial francesa se están traduciendo con IA, lo que ha generado ansiedad entre los profesionales del sector.
item.dc:creator: Jeanna Smialek

media:content.media:credit: Dmitry Kostyukov para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Hojeando una librería en París. La edición de libros es un ejemplo de cómo la inteligencia artificial está arrasando en el campo de la traducción.

item.title: Auditioning to Beat Trump
item.description: Democrats like A.O.C. are testing out their messages in Europe before the midterms.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold

item.title: Frederick Wiseman, 96, Penetrating Documentarian of Institutions, Dies
item.description: He exposed abuses in films like “Titicut Follies,” a once-banned portrait of a mental hospital, but ranged widely in subject matter, from a Queens neighborhood to a French restaurant.
item.dc:creator: John Anderson

media:content.media:description: Mr. Wiseman in an undated photo. “I don’t know if I can offer a general definition of what I’m doing,” he said in 2011, “except to say I’m trying to create dramatic structures out of ordinary experience.”

item.title: Tom Pritzker, Hyatt Heir, Steps Down as Executive Chairman Over Links to Epstein
item.description: The member of a prominent and wealthy family, Mr. Pritzker was in regular contact with the financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Davis O’Brien

media:content.media:description: In a letter sent to the Hyatt Hotels Corporation board on Monday, Thomas J. Pritzker said he had “exercised terrible judgment in maintaining contact” with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: 2 Killed in Shooting at High School Hockey Game in Rhode Island
item.description: The shooter was also dead, apparently by a self-inflicted gunshot wound, the authorities said. The shooting, which the police described as a “targeted event,” happened at the Dennis M. Lynch Arena in Pawtucket.
item.dc:creator: Neil Vigdor and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

media:content.media:description: State Police outside the Dennis M. Lynch Arena, an indoor ice skating rink, after a shooting in Pawtucket, R.I., on Monday.

item.title: Senators Meet Zelensky With Hopeful Message on Sanctions
item.description: During their visit, a pair of Democratic senators made the case for Congress to impose harsh penalties on Moscow for its continuing offensive.
item.dc:creator: Robert Jimison

media:content.media:description: Senators Sheldon Whitehouse of Rhode Island, left, and Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut, center, visiting Kyiv on Monday.

item.title: Progress in Guthrie Case Is Fitful as Search Enters Its Third Week
item.description: Late-night bursts of activity have yielded few visible results as investigators hunt for Nancy Guthrie, the mother of a “Today” show host. The sheriff said Monday that her children and their spouses are not suspects.
item.dc:creator: Reis Thebault and Jack Healy

media:content.media:credit: Cassidy Araiza for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Hopes have soared with each apparent break, but Nancy Guthrie is still missing.

item.title: Where to Watch Robert Duvall’s Top Performances
item.description: He played rugged, capable men drawn from America’s past, present and possible future.
item.dc:creator: Noel Murray

media:content.media:description: In “The Godfather,” Robert Duvall played a lawyer advising a band of Italians who respect his counsel but don’t consider him a trusted insider.

item.title: Muere Robert Duvall, actor de ‘El padrino’ y ‘Apocalypse Now’
item.description: El intérprete, reconocido con el Oscar, era conocido por su capacidad para fundirse con sus personajes al interpretar papeles muy diversos.
item.dc:creator: Clyde Haberman

media:content.media:description: En una larga y variada carrera, Robert Duvall fue nominado a siete premios de la Academia, y obtuvo uno.

item.title: As Guthrie Case Grips Nation, One Police Chief Reflects on His Time in the Spotlight
item.description: “It’s probably something that no one ever expects to happen in their career,” said James Fry, who was the police chief in Moscow, Idaho, when four students were killed there in 2022.
item.dc:creator: Bernard Mokam

media:content.media:credit: Margaret Albaugh for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Moscow, Idaho, faced intense national attention after the 2022 killings of four students at the University of Idaho.

item.title: Canadá se aleja de Estados Unidos en su expansión de gasto militar
item.description: El primer ministro Mark Carney ha resaltado que Canadá ya no adquirirá entre el 70 y el 75 por ciento de sus armas de Estados Unidos, como lo ha hecho históricamente.
item.dc:creator: Ian Austen

media:content.media:credit: Spencer Colby/The Canadian Press, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: El primer ministro Mark Carney en Ottawa, Canadá, el miércoles

item.title: Robert Duvall, ‘Godfather’ and ‘Apocalypse Now’ Actor, Dies at 95
item.description: An Oscar winner, he was known for disappearing into wide-ranging roles in movies like “Apocalypse Now” and “The Godfather” and in the television series “Lonesome Dove.”
item.dc:creator: Clyde Haberman

media:content.media:description: In a long and varied career, Robert Duvall was nominated for seven Academy Awards for acting, and won once.

item.title: Vaccine Makers Curtail Research and Cut Jobs
item.description: Federal policies under Robert F. Kennedy Jr. that are hostile to vaccines have “sent a chill through the entire industry,” one scientist said.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Robbins

media:content.media:description: Moderna says it plans to pull back on late-stage studies of some of its experimental vaccines.

item.title: Columbia Punishes 2 Who Helped Epstein’s Girlfriend Enter Dental College
item.description: The release of documents tied to Jeffrey Epstein has sent ripples through the worlds of business, politics and academia, including at Columbia, where he helped his girlfriend gain entry.
item.dc:creator: Ed Shanahan

media:content.media:description: Columbia University said it will be donating money to nonprofits that work with survivors of sexual abuse after it disclosed that Jeffrey Epstein helped his girlfriend bypass admission standards.

item.title: ‘Tragedy of Coriolanus’ Swerves Off Course in Brooklyn
item.description: Theater for a New Audience’s reimagining of the Shakespearean tragedy misses an opportunity to engage the play’s many echoes with our own tense era.
item.dc:creator: Helen Shaw

media:content.media:description: Mickey Sumner, left, as Aufidius and McKinley Belcher III as Coriolanus in this Theater for a New Audience production at the Polonsky Shakespeare Center in Brooklyn.

item.title: Richard Ottinger, 97, Dies; Fought for the Environment in Congress
item.description: A New York Democrat, he spent 16 years in the House over two stretches, beginning in 1965, championing the health of the Hudson River and opposing the Vietnam War.
item.dc:creator: Joseph P. Fried and Trip Gabriel

media:content.media:description: Richard Ottinger in 1970. He served six years in the House of Representatives beginning in 1965 and another 10 years starting in 1975.

item.title: ‘Tina’ and ‘Milo’ Olympic Mascot Toys Are Almost as Tough to Get as a Medal
item.description: Fans have fallen hard for plush dolls representing Tina and Milo, the mascots of Italy’s Winter Games.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Keh

media:content.media:description: Tina, the Winter Olympics mascot, has been a hot commodity.

item.title: Xi busca la lealtad absoluta en el ejército de China
item.description: El líder de China considera que la adhesión total es vital para construir una fuerza del siglo XXI preparada para el combate y capaz de defender los intereses del país.
item.dc:creator: Lily Kuo
item.category: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (Communist Party of China)

media:content.media:description: El presidente de China, Xi Jinping, en una ceremonia con miembros del Ejército Popular de Liberación chino el año pasado. En los dos últimos años, Xi ha destituido a cinco de los seis generales del máximo órgano militar chino.

item.title: Iran Holds Exercises in Strait of Hormuz After Trump Threatens Military Action
item.description: The day before nuclear talks were set to resume, Iran conducted live drills in the Strait of Hormuz, a strategic waterway for oil and gas shipments.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Nierenberg and Sanam Mahoozi

media:content.media:description: The Strait of Hormuz, a key shipping lane for oil and gas, connects the Persian Gulf to the open ocean.

item.title: Los archivos Epstein insinúan vínculos con la supermodelo Naomi Campbell
item.description: Campbell dijo anteriormente que era conocida del delincuente sexual convicto. Los correos electrónicos dan nuevas luces sobre el alcance de sus interacciones.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta and Jesse McKinley

media:content.media:description: Naomi Campbell desfilando en un evento de moda en París en octubre de 2025.

item.title: Should Drug Companies Be Advertising to Consumers?
item.description: Aging means “becoming a target” of the industry, one expert said. After decades of debate, politicians of all stripes are proposing bans.
item.dc:creator: Paula Span

item.title: How the H-1B Visa Debate Is Driving a Wave of Racism Against South Asians
item.description: A dispute over the impact of H-1B visas on U.S. workers has been overshadowed by racist rhetoric, with troubling echoes of the great replacement conspiracy theory.
item.dc:creator: Amy Qin

media:content.media:credit: Meridith Kohut for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: In Frisco, Texas, one-third of the population is of Asian heritage.
